marklogic.body:
I've said this before & I'll say it again, when Eddie is clean & sober he is still one the deadliest guitarists on the planet today. Forget about his lead playing for a moment, his rhythm & timing alone make him so damn fun to listen to! Tracks like "Girl Gone Bad".."Romeo Delight"..intro to "Mean Street"..intro to "Women In Love".."As Is" & "China Town" Off the new album. Still to this day, nobody sounds just like him & as soon as he plays you KNOW it's Ed. Sure, there are imitators/shredders but they all fall flat & try to squeeze a million notes & scales in there without any feeling. It all ends up sounding like Diarrhea of the fretboard to me. His Beat It solo, that the writer mentions, is a great example...short, sweet & explosive without taking anything away from the song. "Push Comes to Shove" & "One Foot Out the Door" are some of Ed's finest solos ever!
Eddie Van Halen is a guitar legend & I'm happy as hell to be seeing him again on tour this year! :D
